data: Multi-Agent Architecture - LangGraph - LangChain Forum LangChain Forum Multi-Agent Architecture OSS Product Help LangGraph python-help jriedel199715 December 4, 2025, 2:26pm 1 I saw the new deep agents open source library that came out and I am curious on what is the right approach for the best multi agent architecture. In many ways they seem pretty similar even though one emphasizes hierarchy but it seems like deep agents accomplishes the same thing. I know its based on use case and all that but can anyone give their opinion on what is a better standard or library to follow if we are diving deep into building and customizing agent systems using langgraph. I have built my own react library and supervisor (multi agent library) mainly for controlling more things, getting inspiration from the supervisor repo, and I am trying to keep it up to date with the lastest developments. github.com GitHub - langchain-ai/deepagents: Deepagents is an agent harness built on langchain... Deepagents is an agent harness built on langchain and langgraph. Deep agents are equipped with a planning tool, a filesystem backend, and the ability to spawn subagents - making them well-equipped to handle complex agentic tasks. github.com GitHub - langchain-ai/langgraph-supervisor-py Contribute to langchain-ai/langgraph-supervisor-py development by creating an account on GitHub.
